ETYMOLOGY: From Latin versātilis (turning easily, capable of turning), from versāre (to turn often, keep turning), frequentative of vertere (to turn).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Able to adapt or be adapted to many different functions or activities; having many different skills or applications.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 多才多艺的；多功能的；用途广泛的；万用的
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She is a versatile actress, capable of playing both comedy and serious drama roles.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她是一位多才多艺的女演员，能够胜任喜剧和严肃戏剧的角色。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Of an anther) attached to the filament only near its middle or back, allowing it to swing freely.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （花药）活动的，仅以背部连接在花丝上，能自由摆动的
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The pollen is easily dispersed because the anthers of the grass flower are versatile.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 由于草类花的花药是活动的，花粉很容易被散播。
